solution_line_template: Gary earned overtime, so he worked at least {regular_hours} hours. for which he was paid {regular_hours} hours * ${normal_wage}/hour = $<<{regular_hours}*{normal_wage}={regular_pay}>>{regular_pay} at his normal wage.
This means that ${total_pay} - ${regular_pay} = $<<{total_pay}-{regular_pay}={overtime_pay}>>{overtime_pay} was earned at his overtime wage.
His overtime wage is {overtime_multiplier} his normal wage, or ${normal_wage} * {overtime_multiplier} = $<<{normal_wage}*{overtime_multiplier}={overtime_wage}>>{overtime_wage} per hour.
So Gary worked ${overtime_pay} / ${overtime_wage} per hour = <<{overtime_pay}/{overtime_wage}={overtime_hours}>>{overtime_hours} hours' worth of overtime.
So in total, Gary worked {regular_hours} hours + {overtime_hours} hours = <<{regular_hours}+{overtime_hours}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours that week.
